page.title: 09ART COLLECTION (Contd)
page.content: In 1878, he bought two{Turners}and later,after buying a variety of portraits,his interest narrowed to a few specialised subjects. In particular,portraits relating to {Scottish history;}portraits of{British {politicians;Napoleon}and 18th century {London. The earliest of the Scottish paintings is the portrait of{Prince {Henry(1596)}the eldest son of James VI The portrait of his father was done shortly after he became James I of Great Britain.{Charles I}is shown at his execution by{Weesop}and{Charles II is shown in exile in Holland.There are a number of portraits of{Bonnie Prince {Charlie}and one of his wife, Princess Louise of Stolberg painted in Rome in 1772. (next page)
